snippet: President Thein Sein said he would support changing the Constitution to allow “any citizen” to become president, apparently a reference to Daw Aung San Suu Kyi.
abstract: Myanmar Pres Thein Sein says he backs changing the country’s Constitution to allow ‘any citizen’ to become president; statement is apparently a reference to Nobel Prize-winning democracy advocate Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, whose political ambitions have been thwarted for decades by the military.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe contributed reporting from Yangon, Myanmar.

lead_paragraph: President Thein Sein said he would support changing the Constitution to allow “any citizen” to become president, apparently a reference to Daw Aung San Suu Kyi.

headline.main: Myanmar’s Leader Backs Change to Constitution
headline.print_headline: Myanmar’s Leader Backs Change to Constitution
